isis.stitle: ANTILOCK BRAKES/TRACTION CONTROL: ROCKWELL WABCO 4 CHANNEL - INSTALL - REAR WHEEL SENSOR

step1.para: Apply a mineral oil-based lubricant that contains molydisulfide to the sensor clip and to the body of the sensor. The lubricant should have excellent anti-corrosion and adhesion characteristics, and be able to maintain its properties in a temperature range of -40° to 300°F (-40° to 150°C).
Push the sensor spring clip into the mounting block until it stops ( Figure 16).

note.para: Be sure the sensor spring clip is installed with the flange stops on the inboard side (vehicle inboard).

step1.para: Push the sensor completely into the sensor spring clip until it stops against the tooth wheel. No clearance is required between the sensor and tooth wheel ( Figure 16).

Insert the sensor cable through the hole in the spider and housing flange, and route the cable to the frame rail. Be sure to route the cables in a way that will prevent pinching or chafing and will allow sufficient movement for suspension travel.
Connect the sensor cable to the chassis harness.
Install any fasteners that hold the sensor cable in place.
Install the brake drum on the wheel hub.
Install the wheel and tire assembly, and tighten the wheel nuts.
Remove the safety stands from the axle, lower vehicle, and remove wheel blocks.
